result.execSummary:
All charges against Caleb Kenneth Shuman in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Caleb Kenneth Shuman is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caleb Kenneth Shuman

records.addlTxt: of Preliminary Hearing on 9/19/22 before Court Commissioner Heckmann, filed by Electronic Monitor G. Gross. bph
... It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to dismiss is granted and this case is dismissed. Signed by TCH 7/29/22. ec: attys.  gll

AMENDED TO INCLUDE : 22CF432, 20CF866, 20CF916, 20CF922, 21CF15, 21CF16, 21CF91, 21CF145, 21CF196, and 21CF275 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement on today's date. I further understand that I am required to submit to random DRUG testing, at least 3 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in an arrest warrant and/or referral for criminal charges. (715)245-4109. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Defendant may test at JSC or Washburn Co Jail / Sheriff Office if that agency will report test results to SCC JSC. If Washburn will not report, DE must test at JSC.  

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, 1382 Pineview Trail Hudson WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

8:27 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court w/Caleb Kenneth Shuman. INCLUDES: 22CF432 (PH/BBH),20CF866, 20CF916, 20CF922, 21CF15, 21CF16, 21CF91, 21CF145, 21CF196, and 21CF275 (all set for BBH). Court calls 22CF432. S/T Robert Wood, former Hammond Police Officer, direct by Atty Smestad. Record reflects identity of DE. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Attys argue bind over. Court questions officer. Atty Harrelson further cross. Court is going to take bind over under advisement and issue a written decision. Court confirms address of DE. Court addresses bond modification. Attys provide stipulated language for bonds on all matters. Court orders modification on all bonds. DE should check in with JSC and sign a release if needed for Washburn Co. Will set I/R and JA will coordinate next hearing. Adjourned: 9:04 am.

2:57 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad and Alec Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Caleb Kenneth Shuman. Defendant Caleb Kenneth Shuman appeared by video. INCLUDES 20CF866, 20CF916, 20CF922, 21CF15, 22CF16, 21CF91, 21CF145, 21CF196, 21CF275 and 22CF432. Atty. Harrelson requests bond modification, requests DE to test at Washburn County Sheriff's Office. Court does not modify bond at this time due to multiple bonds with multiple conditions. Court approves Commissioner to modify bond if counsel agrees to wording at 7/19 hearing. Atty. Smestad requests information regarding DE's sober house living status. Atty. Harrelson responds. Adjourned: 3:09 PM. kma

10:04 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Caleb Kenneth Shuman in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Caleb Kenneth Shuman. Includes 2020CF000916 BBH, 2020CF000922 BBH, 2021CF000015 BBH, 2021CF000016 BBH, 2021CF000091 BBH, 2021CF000145 BBH, 2021CF000196 BBH, 2021CF000275 BBH, 2021CF000654 BBH, and 2022CF000432 INIT. Atty Harrelson states 22CF432 is refiled from 21CF654 that was dismissed at prelim. Atty Harrelson addresses bond. Atty Harrelson states DE is not tested at treatment other than initially upon entering into treatment. Court suggests testing in Shell Lake, but attys to look into if that's a possibility. ADA Brekken states JSC advised that DE hadn't reported since he was released from custody as of 6/24/22. Court orders Defendant to test today (6/30) at JSC. Court would also like to know the history of DE's testing in this county in the last 3 months including failed tests. Atty Harrelson states DE tested on 6/24/22. Court sets bond in 22CF432, but will not modify other bonds today and sets further BBH via Zoom. DE confirms address and updates phone number. Adjourned at
